    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void aiPaddleMovement(Player p)
      updates the AI's position
      void collisionHandler()
      calls the collision functions, in order to check if the game is finished and to change the ball's direction
      Ball getBall() 
      Obstacle[] getObstacles() 
      Player getP1() 
      Player getP2() 
      boolean getPlaying() 
      void obstacleCollisionHandler(Ball ball)
      checks if ball collided with obstacles, if it did the ball direction is changed
      void paddleMovement(Player p, double targetPos)
      updates player position
      boolean player1CollisionHandler()
      checks if the ball collided with the paddle, if it did it changes the ball´s direction, and sets finalPosition=-1 so that the next final position of the ball is calculated
      boolean player2CollisionHandler()
      checks if the ball collided with the paddle, if it did it changes the ball´s direction, and sets finalPosition=-1 so that the next final position of the ball is calculated
      void readVariables()
      reads the ballVelocity, paddleVelocity and computerPaddleVelocity from the settings file
      void setPlaying(boolean a) 
      void simulation()
      makes a simulation of the current game to calculate the position where the AI paddle needs to be to hit the ball
      void update_unitTest()
      update used by unit tests
      void update()
      updates the game every frame
      void wallCollisionHandler()
      checks if the ball collided with the walls, if it did it changes the ball´s direction, if it collides with the right or left wall it means that the game ended and the player score is incremented

      • readVariables

        public void readVariables()
        reads the ballVelocity, paddleVelocity and computerPaddleVelocity from the settings file

        updates the game every frame

        update used by unit tests

                           double targetPos)

        targetPos - position where the player wants to be

        public Ball getBall()
        Returns:
        ball object

      • getPlaying

        public boolean getPlaying()
        Returns:
        if true the game is active, if false it is not

      • setPlaying

        public void setPlaying(boolean a)
        Parameters:
        a - sets playing

      • player1CollisionHandler

        public boolean player1CollisionHandler()
        checks if the ball collided with the paddle, if it did it changes the ball´s direction, and sets finalPosition=-1 so that the next final position of the ball is calculated
        Returns:
        true if the ball collided with the paddle of player 1,false otherwise

      • player2CollisionHandler

        public boolean player2CollisionHandler()
        checks if the ball collided with the paddle, if it did it changes the ball´s direction, and sets finalPosition=-1 so that the next final position of the ball is calculated
        Returns:
        true if the ball collided with the paddle of player 2,false otherwise

      • wallCollisionHandler

        public void wallCollisionHandler()
        checks if the ball collided with the walls, if it did it changes the ball´s direction, if it collides with the right or left wall it means that the game ended and the player score is incremented

      • obstacleCollisionHandler

        public void obstacleCollisionHandler(Ball ball)
        checks if ball collided with obstacles, if it did the ball direction is changed
        Parameters:
        ball - object to be used

      • collisionHandler

        public void collisionHandler()
        calls the collision functions, in order to check if the game is finished and to change the ball's direction

      • getP1

        public Player getP1()
        Returns:
        player 1

      • getP2

        public Player getP2()
        Returns:
        player 2

      • getObstacles

        public Obstacle[] getObstacles()
        Returns:
        obstacle array

      • simulation

        public void simulation()
        makes a simulation of the current game to calculate the position where the AI paddle needs to be to hit the ball
